channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for IN
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for IN

item.title: Report E-2024010003
item.description:
Report E-2024010003

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-09T06:14:28+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-02
  • City: Connersville
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: RECLAIMED ENERGY CO., INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: While unloading drums noticed a puddle under the drum. It was found that the drum body had a hole in it and material leaked out. Drum was placed in overpack, and material cleaned up in house. The hole was caused by a bolt from another drum.

item.title: Report X-2023121000
item.description:
Report X-2023121000

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-09T06:14:28+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-14
  • City: INDIANAPOLIS
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A plastic drum was discovered with signs of a release during sort operations at the INDH facility. The drum had a small puncture on the bottom causing the release. The drum was placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report X-2023121143
item.description:
Report X-2023121143

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-05T18:16:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-15
  • City: INDIANAPOLIS
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: BOTTLE NOTICED ON THE SECONDARY SLIDE LEAKING. MANAGEMENT NOTIFIED RESPONDERS. RESPONDERS DONNED PPE AND FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE. DECISION TREE TOOK RESPONDERS TO THE CORROSIVE RESPONSE SHEET. GOGGLES, BOOTS, APRONS, AND GLOVES USING THE SILVER SHELD INNER LINERS. SCBA WAS NOT REQUIRED. ALL HAZARDS WERE FOLLOWED. PH WAS TESTED AS A 0. SODIUM BICARBONATE WAS USED AND AREA WAS RETESTED AS A 7. ALL MATERIAL WAS CONTAINERIZED INTO A LINED SPILL TRAY WITH A FIBER BROOK AND A PLASTIC DUSTPAN. ALL RESIDUE WAS REMOVED FORM THE SPILL LOCATION AND TRANSPORTED PACKAGE TO PACKAGE SERVICE CENTER FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

item.title: Report X-2023120735
item.description:
Report X-2023120735

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-05T18:16:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-13
  • City: EVANSVILLE
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was being transported via NC belt when it was knocked off, landing on its side. Package found by management and placed in hazmat spill tote, which is where it was found by QA. Package was emitting very strong, pungent odor. DescribePack: Package was soaked on multiple sides, cardboard/fiberboard was disintegrating. Upon inspection, 1 jug of muriatic acid was found to have a loose cap, causing roughly half of its contents to spill out and onto remaining 3 jugs. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package placed in hazmat spill tote with lid on to prevent fumes from escaping, then placed in hazmat cage underneath exhaust vent. Spillage treated with spill absorbent powder, powder placed in blue hazmat bag.
